title: Jensen McRae Packs Her Bags on Stirring New Single “Savannah”: Stream
description: The artist and poet's sophomore album, I Don't Know How But They Found Me!, is set to arrive in April. Jensen McRae Packs Her Bags on Stirring New Single “Savannah”: Stream Mary Siroky
author: Mary Siroky
excerpt: Singer-songwriter Jensen McRae has shared her new song, "Savannah," the latest preview of her upcoming album, I Don’t Know How But They Found Me!
text: Singer-songwriter Jensen McRae has unveiled her new song, “Savannah,” the latest single from her forthcoming album, I Don’t Know How But They Found Me! Stream it below. The tender exploration of moving on and rebuilding a life is accompanied by an artful music video, directed by Rena Johnson, that sees McRae wandering an empty church in a wedding veil. “There is an intersection in your college town with your name on it,” she sings in the opening of the song before revealing that she’s fallen in love with someone new. Even as the ghosts of her past swirl around her, she walks forward. Get Jensen McRae Tickets Here On “Savannah,” McRae affirms her distinct approach to songwriting, in which she skillfully blends specific and seemingly personal details with highly relatable premises. It follows the release of singles “Praying on Your Downfall” and “Massachusetts,” the latter of which received a boost after an acoustic performance of the track made the rounds on TikTok. All three songs will be included on I Don’t Know How But They Found Me! when it arrives on April 25th. Pre-orders are ongoing. In celebration of the new album, McRae will be embarking on a headlining tour in May. See the full list of dates below, and grab tickets here. Jensen McRae 2025 Tour Dates: 05/03 — Philadelphia, PA @ World Cafe Live 05/04 — Washington, DC @ The Atlantis 05/07 — New York, NY @ Bowery Ballroom 05/10 — Boston, MA @ The Sinclair 05/12 — Montreal, QC @ Fairmount Theatre 05/13 — Toronto, ON @ The Axis Club 05/15 — Chicago, IL @ Lincoln Hall 05/16 — Minneapolis, MN @ Varsity Theater 05/18 — Denver, CO @ Bluebird Theater 05/19 — Salt Lake City, UT @ Soundwell 05/21 — Vancouver, BC @ Hollywood Theatre 05/22 — Seattle, WA @ Neumos 05/23 — Portland, OR @ Hawthorne Theatre 05/25 — Napa, CA @ BottleRock 05/28 — Los Angeles, CA @ El Rey Theatre 06/10 — Berlin, DE @ Privatclub 06/12 — Amsterdam, NL @ Bitterzoet 06/14 — Brussels, BE @ Botanique 06/16 — Paris, FR @ Le Hasard Ludique 06/18 — Dublin, IE @ The Workman’s Cellar 06/20 — Glasgow, UK @ SWG3 Poetry Club 06/21 — Manchester, UK @ Deaf Institute 06/22 — Bristol, UK @ The Exchange
html:
Singer-songwriter Jensen McRae has unveiled her new song, “Savannah,” the latest single from her forthcoming album, I Don’t Know How But They Found Me! Stream it below.

The tender exploration of moving on and rebuilding a life is accompanied by an artful music video, directed by Rena Johnson, that sees McRae wandering an empty church in a wedding veil. “There is an intersection in your college town with your name on it,” she sings in the opening of the song before revealing that she’s fallen in love with someone new. Even as the ghosts of her past swirl around her, she walks forward.

Get Jensen McRae Tickets Here

On “Savannah,” McRae affirms her distinct approach to songwriting, in which she skillfully blends specific and seemingly personal details with highly relatable premises. It follows the release of singles “Praying on Your Downfall” and “Massachusetts,” the latter of which received a boost after an acoustic performance of the track made the rounds on TikTok.

All three songs will be included on I Don’t Know How But They Found Me! when it arrives on April 25th. Pre-orders are ongoing.

In celebration of the new album, McRae will be embarking on a headlining tour in May. See the full list of dates below, and grab tickets here.
